title: Is there a plan to update the old legendary skins?
body: All these new skins have cool recall animations, and all the old legendary skins lack this. =( I love playing Zombie Brand, Brolaf, Corporate Mundo, Gentleman Cho'gath and many others, but I'm sad there aren't at the very least recall animations for them. Plz tell me there are plans on updating these skins...

replies.body:
Hey Zanendrox,

At this time, we don't have plans to update the older skins. (Sorry to be the bearer of bad news. D:)

=( thats so sad. Plz suggest this do the development team... it seems irresponsible to let the legendary skin infrastructure fall behind the times into disrepair. These old 1820 skins now have less going on than the 1350 skins =(

My above comment isn't to say that this isn't possible in the future. 

Skins from 2010 certainly don't compare to the skins we've put out more recently. The increase in quality does make some of the older content appear outdated. 

We (skins team) have released more skins than ever this year, and at this time, we're focusing our efforts on newer content. Champion Update also has their hands full with some large scale reworks such as Poppy and Taric.

I know that you are not the Rioter who is making the decisions about the pricing of a champions skins, that being said do you know about any discussion about restructuring any of the pricing of older once legendary skins.

Cho'Gath is an excellent example. He has two skins of a legendary tier in both Gentleman Cho and Battlecast Prime Cho. The former being of a glaringly lower level of design. A real shame as I think Gentleman Cho is one of the coolest skin in terms of concept despite the lack of execution when compared to Battlecast. 

With the apparent disparity in quality which according to the official Riot price guidelines is the primary consideration for the pricing of skins why is a re-pricing not on the table similar to older Champions? Is it more Riot feels unwilling to tell players that have already purchased it the skin if not of a 1820 RP quality?  Is there fear that this is a bad precedent? Is it on the table and players are not in the loop yet?

As I said I know the skins team is not likely the team that decides these things but since you are available I thought I would ask for any insight on these kind of things as your post seemed to imply that the updating of skins is not a high priority at Riot at this time.
Unfortunately, that's not something I can really speak to, as I'm involved with the development of the skins, as opposed to the pricing.

they have touched on this in the past actually. On a few occasions they have actually lowered the cost of a legendary skin, Lion Dance Kog'Maw is the one that always comes to my mind. When they did lower the cost, everyone who had purchased the skin before the price reduction were refunded the difference in RP.

The 2 reasons they dont really want to do that again is 1. they dont want to cheapen the content and point out it being outdated and of poorer quality which looks bad upon those that made it. 2. They do not want to create a bunch of confusion and unnecessary fallout with those that have already purchased the older legendary skins by reducing their price even if they do refund the RP.
WAIT WAIT WAIT so your telling me the gems man is gonna drop the waffle feet and get a new shine to his dusty old rocks.
Don't forget Cassiopeia*

Thanks for your time, I hope this makes it on the agenda sometime in the next year or 2, perhaps in the off-season. I appreciate all of the new skin content, but it makes the older skins look more and more like the old summoners rift if you know what I mean. Have a nice day.
If older skins are starting to be outclassed by new ones, will they ever see a price reduction if there's no plans to update them?

Many of the older skins live in the Legacy Vault, and will come back to the shop periodically. Skins such as Magnificent Twisted Fate are discounted at that point, since you're right, they aren't the same quality is some of the more recent legendary skins.

Wait wait wait. I thought those older Legendary skins were price protect. Maybe I should get the link and post it.

Edit: http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3328361
That link goes to the Hippalus thread that talks about price changes, and towards the bottom he mentions that Legardary skins are price protected. That's why players were given refunds when certain skins were moved from that tier. Has this policy changed?

They're price protected in general, but retired legendaries have gone back to unprotected, but when they did, we refunded everyone who ever purchased them the difference.

The instance I'm referring to is [this](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/store/sales/battle-boss-blitzcrank-sends-skins-hiding), where Magnificent Twisted Fate was 50% off for a day.

I was curious - what does the skin/update team organization look like/how are the groups split up? I know there is a team that is organized around champ updates. With the continued release of champions the pool grows larger and larger and eventually the update team will have to grow to address these issues right?

We have a Champion Team that works on creating new champions, Skins Team that creates new skins, and Champion Update that works on updating older content (Sion VU, or texture rebalances, for example). You're correct that with the addition of more content the teams do need to scale, and do when necessary.

Just to jump in for a second, whats your opinion of Blood Lord Vladimir? It doesn't seem to match up to the quality of other Legendary skins, bringing only a new VO and a few new animations. There aren't any new particles, at least not any particularly noticeable ones, and new particles seems to be a rather important point for a legendary skins.

As a skin released in late 2011, it has become a bit dated, as compared to newer legendary skins. The particles are different, however, since he's a 'blood lord' the particles are still, well, blood, which isn't a huge step away from his base.

Would you happen to know the current size of each team? 5-6 people etc? Would be interesting to see how the workload is distributed.

Thanks Katey!
They're all fairly large teams, I don't have the exact numbers. Each team is comprised of several  animators, particle artists, modelers, audio engineers, QA, etc.
When are you going to release a new Cass skin? It's been over 2 1/2 years since her last one, she doesn't even have a legendary skin yet.
Unfortunately, I can't give an ETA for a Cassiopeia skin, or a skin for any other champion. That said, we know it's been a bit of time since her last skin - she certainly hasn't been forgotten.

Is there a reason why champions like Ahri get skin releases on an annual basis? 

That seems a bit biased if you ask me.

It's not a bias, but rather, how well a champion fits into a thematic we're executing. You're correct that some champions may receive skins more often than others.

We are aware of champions who need skins, and have catered to many of them so far this year, such as Headhunter Akali, PROJECT: Yi, PROJECT: Zed, PROJECT: Fiora, Debonair Galio. These were several champions who'd been waiting 2.5-3 years for a skin. 

Fiora was a special case because we were reworking her. For the others, it was a matter of finding a thematic that really hit home for them, and gave them a solid alternative fantasy. 

Since you mentioned Ahri - we felt she was a really strong candidate for the Academy. Similarly, we picked Ekko, despite him being a newer champion.

and out of them galio got the bitter end of the deal ... 750 skin after 2.5-3 years was very disappointing :(
{{champion:3}} soon to be {{champion:32}}  friend D:
{{champion:28}} 750 after 4 years..
Now I just want victorious Sion :p

[Well I feel that the dear snakelady has been treated in a very poorly manner so far.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/rBbcJyIV-cassiopeia-a-history-of-ongoing-neglection) To make matters worse, she's been reduced to the likes of Urgot in terms of popularity and struggles to even keep up with her performance compared to the far more popular (and newer) champions. She feels inferior in so many ways and I think a new skin would help her gain some of that much needed attention from players and balance team alike.

Thanks again for replying Katey! I think it would be a great idea to bring up the composition and structure of teams in the community communication to give players and idea of the amount of work required to make everything come together whether its a new champ, new skin, etc.

You're welcome! 

I think a bit more clarity in terms of the development process could help everyone understand the kind of work that goes into a skin - there's a pretty good chunk of work for even a 750 RP skin. Champions are a whole other realm and have a ton of work that goes into them 'cause they're starting from the ground up. At least with skins, we know what the champion does, and can concept skills based off their kit. :P

On a somewhat related note, will we at least get a possible change to Gentleman Cho'Gath's splash art? I feel at least he could get that for being an old skin. 

Also if I may ask, can we also get a change to Phantom Karthus's splash so it represents his actual skin please?
While I don't know which splashes are coming soon, I do know the splash team isn't done with updating older splash arts. I can bring up the requests!

Maybe this potiential "legendary skin update" team could consist of people that aren't fully commited to one particular thing, and they help refocus the legendary skin to help it feel "legendary" once again when its base champion is up for a VU
That's too bad, but thanks for showing up.
:O The Two Faced "D:)" at the end!!!  You're Planning some thing aren't you!!!
